alert.note: Alert for Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 14 at 6:22PM EDT until July 14 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... West central Warren County in northwestern New Jersey... South central Monroe County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northeastern Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 622 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Bangor, or 10 miles north of Easton, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Belvidere, Belfast, East Bangor, Delaware Water Gap, Stormville, Saylorsburg, Columbia, Roxburg, Roseto and Portland. This includes Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 2 and 11. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
